intro: Parosela melantha, commonly known as the bluebell of the Canary Islands, is a flowering plant native to the volcanic islands of the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms during the spring months. Parosela melantha is a rare and endemic species, making it a significant part of the local flora.
